document_title: Bipolar disorder: Symptoms diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
1. Bipolar I affective disorder
Bipolar I disorder is characterized by manic episodes or alternating depressive episodes.
2. Bipolar II affective disorder
People with bipolar II disorder are characterized by episodes of depression alternating with hypomania
3. Bipolar III disorder
It is characterized by recurring depressive episodes that turn into mania when using drugs. There is also a family history of bipolar disorder.
Rapid cycling bipolar disorder is characterized by at least four episodes within a year.
Bipolar disorder with psychotic features: accompanied by symptoms of psychosis (loud voices, visual hallucinations...
Bipolar disorder with atypical features (Atypical features) with symptoms of eating too much and sleeping too much, early onset, young age, psychomotor retardation, and other psychological disorders. (2)
